text: Poured from a 22 ounce bomber. Malty, Bready, dried fruit, light tannic character, caramel. A great lager.

Bottle, picked up a few weeks ago in Corvallis. Now that its the height of summer it seems a good time to crack this. Clear deep dark pour with lovely dense creamy head, though not much for lacing. Aroma brings cola, caramel, and some dark fruit. Taste is moderately sweet, but finishes dry enough. Light bitterness. Palate: light+ body, slick texture. Overall: Probably better to consume this closer to winter, but solid even these 6 months later.

22 oz. bottle about 5 months old. It pours a deep ruddy, reddish brown color with a small khaki head. The aroma jumps out initially with some dry cocoa powder, rich bread and bread crust, mild fruity raisin, plum and red grape. Fruitiness comes out more as it warms. The flavor has more fruity, light caramel sweetness, rich bready malt, mild hints of cocoa and roast that mingle with some earthy bitterness in the finish. Very smooth, soft mouthfeel with low to medium acidity. Nice toasted, bitter finish. Another tasty lager from Heater Allen.
Bottle. Brown beer with a thin tan head.. Light roast and light caramel aroma. Caramel and cocoa flavor with light roast. Medium bodied. Caramel and cocoa linger with light roast and light mineral.

Pours a half finger of head on a hazy dark red body.
The aroma is caramel and dark grains. Nice.
The taste has moderate sweetness with good balance. Malty and caramel.
The texture is thicker but smooth.
Quite drinkable.

Bottle. Pours deep ruby chestnut, medium creamy tan head with decent staying power and nice lacing. Aroma is malty, nutty, pumpernickel, a bit of rye perhaps. Flavor is light plus sweet, light bitter, malty, roasted, dark breads, nutty. Medium body, very drinkable!

The beer is deep amber in color. It appears to have good clarity. Nice thick beige head. Some lacing. The aroma is rich with toasty malt sweetness. Its clean and nutty caramel. No cloying flavors or off notes. Taste is medium sweet but wonderfully clean. Rich and full. Nutty, toasty, malty. Full feel. Easy to drink. Very nice.

22 oz bomber bought from "Lifesource" in Salem.
$4.99
Pours a slightly hazy darker brown with a nice sized, bubbly/rocky tan head.
Nice semi-dark chocolate malty aromas, ..some coffee aspects too.
Smooth chocolate and coffee tastes, Sweet cream finish and and maybe a touch of hop. Nice.
Good smooth medium bodied palate.
Excellent as usual from this brewer.

Bomber from Made in Oregon. Pours dark copper with a beige/tan head. Aroma of dark malt with fruit, spic and herb notes. A little leather. Flavor is somrwhat dark smooth malt with fruit and spice hop notes. Good drink.
Bottle shared by bhensonb. Pours reddish amber with a transient beige head and a fruity malt aroma. There is a dark malt flavor with a hint of leather and a slightly bitter finish.
